alert.note: Alert for Montague (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 04 at 6:21PM CDT until October 04 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Montague. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bowie, Nocona, St. Jo, Lake Nocona, Sunset, Lake Amon G Carter, Nocona Hills, Montague, Mallard, Bonita, Belcherville, Stoneburg, Fruitland, Forestburg, Capps Corner, Ringgold, Spanish Fort and Illinois Bend.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
